chat_messages.text:
<antThinking>Need to create a comprehensive IDirectionSystem interface that supports both direction validation and localization, while keeping it flexible for different types of direction systems (compass, space, etc).</antThinking>

<antArtifact identifier="direction-interface" type="application/vnd.ant.code" language="csharp" title="IDirectionSystem Interface">
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

namespace IFWorldModel
{
    /// <summary>
    /// Defines the contract for a direction system in an interactive fiction world.
    /// This system handles both the logical relationships between directions and their localized representations.
    /// </summary>
    public interface IDirectionSystem
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Gets all valid directions in the system.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>A collection of internal direction names.</returns>
        IEnumerable<string> GetAllDirections();

        /// <summary>
        /// Gets the canonical name for a direction based on its ID.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="directionId">The numeric identifier for the direction.</param>
        /// <returns>The internal name of the direction.</returns>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentException">If the direction ID is invalid.</exception>
        string GetDirectionName(int directionId);

        /// <summary>
        /// Gets the localized display name for a direction.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="direction">The internal direction name.</param>
        /// <returns>The localized name of the direction for display.</returns>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentException">If the direction is invalid.</exception>
        string GetDirectionDisplayName(string direction);

        /// <summary>
        /// Gets the opposite direction for the given direction.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="direction">The internal direction name.</param>
        /// <returns>The internal name of the opposite direction.</returns>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentException">If the direction is invalid.</exception>
        string GetOppositeDirection(string direction);

        /// <summary>
        /// Checks if the given direction is valid in this direction system.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="direction">The direction to validate.</param>
        /// <returns>True if the direction is valid; otherwise false.</returns>
        bool IsValidDirection(string direction);

        /// <summary>
        /// Gets any valid abbreviations for the given direction.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="direction">The internal direction name.</param>
        /// <returns>A collection of valid abbreviations for the direction.</returns>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentException">If the direction is invalid.</exception>
        IEnumerable<string> GetAbbreviations(string direction);

        /// <summary>
        /// Attempts to resolve an abbreviation to its full direction name.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="abbreviation">The abbreviation to resolve.</param>
        /// <param name="direction">The resolved direction name if successful; otherwise null.</param>
        /// <returns>True if the abbreviation was successfully resolved; otherwise false.</returns>
        bool TryResolveAbbreviation(string abbreviation, out string direction);

        /// <summary>
        /// Gets all relative directions from one direction.
        /// For example, in a compass system, "left" from "north" would be "west".
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="fromDirection">The reference direction.</param>
        /// <param name="relativeDirection">The relative direction (e.g., "left", "right", "behind").</param>
        /// <returns>The absolute direction name based on the relative position.</returns>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentException">If either direction is invalid.</exception>
        string GetRelativeDirection(string fromDirection, string relativeDirection);

        /// <summary>
        /// Gets the primary cardinal directions used in the system.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>A collection of the main directional references.</returns>
        IEnumerable<string> GetPrimaryDirections();

        /// <summary>
        /// Gets the list of valid relative direction terms (e.g., "left", "right", "behind").
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>A collection of valid relative direction terms.</returns>
        IEnumerable<string> GetRelativeDirectionTerms();
    }
}
</antArtifact>

This interface provides:

1. Basic Direction Operations:
   - Validation of directions
   - Getting all valid directions
   - Finding opposite directions
   - Looking up direction names
   - Getting display names

2. Abbreviation Support:
   - Getting valid abbreviations
   - Resolving abbreviations to full names
   - Flexible shortcut handling

3. Relative Direction Support:
   - Converting relative to absolute directions
   - Managing primary directions
   - Handling relative terms

4. Localization Integration:
   - Separate internal names from display names
   - Language-agnostic direction relationships
   - Cultural adaptability

Example usage:
```csharp
// In a compass-based game
var direction = directionSystem.GetDirectionDisplayName("north"); // "north" or "norte"
var opposite = directionSystem.GetOppositeDirection("north");     // "south"
var isValid = directionSystem.IsValidDirection("n");             // true
directionSystem.TryResolveAbbreviation("n", out var fullDir);    // true, fullDir = "north"
var left = directionSystem.GetRelativeDirection("north", "left"); // "west"

// In a space-based game
direction = directionSystem.GetDirectionDisplayName("fore");      // "fore" or "proa"
opposite = directionSystem.GetOppositeDirection("port");         // "starboard"
var mainDirs = directionSystem.GetPrimaryDirections();           // ["fore", "aft", "port", "starboard"]
```

This interface allows for different types of direction systems:
1. Traditional compass directions
2. Nautical directions
3. Space navigation
4. Custom direction systems (e.g., for abstract spaces)

Would you like to see a complete implementation of this interface for either the compass or space navigation system?
